alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 1:54AM CDT until June 15 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Nebraska and south central Nebraska, including the following counties, in east central Nebraska, York. In south central Nebraska, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Lincoln Creek, Stone Creek, Galaway Creek, Antelope Creek, North Fork Johnson Creek, Indian Creek, Coon Branch Lincoln Creek, School Creek, Dry Run Creek, Sleepy Hollow Creek, and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... York, Aurora, Henderson, Hampton, McCool Junction, Bradshaw, Waco, Benedict, Stockham, Lushton and Thayer. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
